SENT.plain: Beckwith-Wiedemann syndrome is a congenital syndrome with some anomaly in overgrowth
Most common manifestations are exomphalos, macroglossia, gigantism, and visceromegaly
Overgrowth in tongue's size caused clinical symptoms such as dysphagia, speech disorder, strong in chewing, upper-airway obstruction, and psychological problems with appearance
Cold surgical techniques are commonly used in treating macroglossia
We presented tongue reduction with laser and its early result on a child with Beckwith-Wiedemann syndrome for macroglossia
